alert.note: Alert for Auglaize; Mercer (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 16 at 3:11PM EST until February 18 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. 1 to 2 inches of rainfall with locally higher amounts are expected Thursday through Thursday night. * WHERE...Portions of Indiana and Ohio, including the following counties, in Indiana, Dearborn, Fayette IN, Franklin IN, Ripley, Union IN and Wayne. In Ohio, Auglaize, Butler, Champaign, Clark, Clinton, Darke, Delaware, Fairfield, Fayette OH, Franklin OH, Greene, Hamilton, Hardin, Hocking, Licking, Logan, Madison, Mercer, Miami, Montgomery, Pickaway, Preble, Ross, Shelby, Union OH and Warren. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Soils remain moist and excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.
info.instruction: People in the watch area, especially those living in areas prone to flooding, should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Monitor the latest forecasts and be alert for possible flood warnings.
